*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas J. Chambers to Austin, June 8, 1830. East Texas now tranquil, and unless there is a new exciting cause there will be no trouble.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F. Austin.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dr Sir, I received yours of the *date_mentioned n="05-27-1830">27th Ult.*/date_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="06-07-1830">yesterday*/date_mentioned*. Nothing worthy of note has transpired here since my last. On my return from *location_mentioned*St. Felipe */location_mentioned*I found some excitement, and some imprudent measures were taking, which, in all probability would have lead to serious difficulties; but everything is now quiet and tranquil, and nothing is to be feared from the imprudence of the people in this *location_mentioned*quarter*/location_mentioned*, without some new exciting cause.*/p*
*p*I do not answer your letter in full, as, *date_mentioned n="06-23-1830">fifteen days hence*/date_mentioned*, I will see you in*location_mentioned* St. Felipe*/location_mentioned*. I wish to advise further with you respecting the business in this part of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*T. J. Chambers*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Nacogdoches */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="06-08-1830">8th. June 1830*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:]*person_mentioned* Col. Stephen Austin */person_mentioned* *location_mentioned* St. Felipe*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
